layer.name: Causality
layer.definition: Actions have consequences; you reap what you sow.

questions.text: My current physical capability is the result of what I've been doing physically ...

answers.4: mostly — my physical state reflects my physical investment
answers.5: directly — I am what I consistently do
answers.2: possibly — but genetics set most of it
answers.3: partially — some capability is earned, some is given
answers.1: not really — I'm just naturally where I am

questions.text: People who are physically fit built that fitness through consistent effort ...

answers.4: mostly — fitness is built through work over time
answers.5: definitely — there are no genetic shortcuts to real fitness
answers.2: possibly — but genetics plays a bigger role
answers.3: partly — effort helps, but some have it easier
answers.1: not necessarily — some people are just naturally fit

questions.text: 'Use it or lose it' as a law of the body is ...

answers.5: absolute law — the body adapts to what you demand of it
answers.2: possibly true — but bodies are resilient
answers.3: sometimes true — some abilities fade quickly, others persist
answers.1: overstated — capability doesn't decline that fast

questions.text: Expecting physical improvement without physical effort is ...

answers.5: asking for magic — physical results require physical investment
answers.3: optimistic — some improvement happens without effort
answers.1: not unreasonable — some people improve naturally

questions.text: I can trace my current strength, endurance, and mobility back to my patterns ...
questions.principle: Physical state is traceable to physical practices

answers.4: mostly — I can see how my patterns shaped my capability
answers.5: clearly — my body is the accumulated result of my movement choices
answers.3: partially — some of it traces back, some doesn't
answers.1: not really — my physical state feels random
